description: A dropdown select component for choosing from a list of options

defaultOpen.description: Default open state for uncontrolled usage

SelectTrigger.description: The button that toggles the select dropdown

placeholder.description: Placeholder text when no value is selected

SelectLabel.description: Label for a group of items

accessibility.notes: Full keyboard navigation with arrow keys. Screen readers announce selected value and options. Focus is trapped within dropdown when open.

bestPractices: Always include a placeholder or default value
Use SelectGroup and SelectLabel for long lists
Use disabled state for unavailable options
Consider native select for mobile accessibility

examples.name: Basic Select
examples.code:
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger className="w-[180px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select option" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="option2">Option 2</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="option3">Option 3</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

examples.name: Controlled Select
examples.code:
<Select value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
  <SelectTrigger className="w-[200px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select a fruit" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="apple">Apple</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="banana">Banana</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="orange">Orange</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

examples.name: Grouped Select
examples.code:
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger className="w-[280px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select a timezone" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectGroup>
      <SelectLabel>North America</SelectLabel>
      <SelectItem value="est">Eastern Standard Time</SelectItem>
      <SelectItem value="cst">Central Standard Time</SelectItem>
      <SelectItem value="pst">Pacific Standard Time</SelectItem>
    </SelectGroup>
    <SelectSeparator />
    <SelectGroup>
      <SelectLabel>Europe</SelectLabel>
      <SelectItem value="gmt">Greenwich Mean Time</SelectItem>
      <SelectItem value="cet">Central European Time</SelectItem>
    </SelectGroup>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

examples.name: Small Size
examples.code:
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger size="sm" className="w-[120px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Size" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="sm">Small</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="md">Medium</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="lg">Large</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>

aiGuidance.whenToUse: Use for selecting a single option from a list of 5+ options where space is limited. Ideal for forms, filters, and settings.
aiGuidance.whenNotToUse: Don't use for 2-3 options (use RadioGroup), binary choices (use Switch/Checkbox), or multiple selections (use multi-select or checkboxes)
alternatives: RadioGroup - for 2-5 mutually exclusive options that should all be visible
DropdownMenu - for actions instead of selection
commonMistakes: Using Select for very long lists without search (use Combobox)
